Description: Typical range for delicate glass substrates like Gorilla Glass to avoid thermal damage; starting at 50W for light contamination removal. Max safe below 200W to prevent cracking due to low thermal conductivity (~1 W/mK). Source: IPG Photonics laser cleaning guidelines for optics; academic review in Journal of Laser Applications (2018).
Optimal wavelength for Gorilla Glass processing with good absorption
Optimal spot size for precision cleaning of Gorilla Glass surfaces
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Optimal pulse width for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Optimal number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap ratio for uniform cleaning coverage
